alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Orange and east central Windsor Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hartland, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White River Junction, Woodstock, Hartland Four Corners, Hartland, Hartford, Quechee, Norwich, Pomfret, Windsor, Queechee State Park, Taftsville, Pompanoosuc, North Hartland Dam Recreation Area, and North Hartland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 91 between mile markers 60 and 61, and between mile markers 63 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
